title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional resolutions of disapproval and exercise rulemaking power. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to remove congressional resolutions of disapproval and exercise rulemaking power. The rules of each House shall supersede other rules only to the extent that they are inconsistent, with recognition of the constitutional right of either House to change such rules at any time. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended in various sections, including changes to subsections and provisions related to payments not subject to appropriation. Amendments are made to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding payments not subject to appropriation, specifically related to revenue anticipation notes and initiative and referendum provisions. Amendments to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act include changes to sections related to initiative and referendum provisions, specifically regarding the appropriate custodian and parts of the act. The amendments made by this Act to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act will apply to acts passed by the Council and signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed, allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of voters on or after October 1, 2002.
